review_blob: Bottle. Pours a dark brownish red color and a thin brown head. Light hop nose with hints of caramel. Great balance between being to hoppy and just right especially for the style. Finish is sweet with maybe some toffee notes at the end. Real nice brew all around.

Draft @ Callys. Very light yellow straw color with a slight honey aroma. Very grainy   and quite unimpressive. There lightest beer that they had when i was there, certainly they have better things to drink.

On Draft @ Callys. Very very thin slight white head, strong apricot nose. Pours a very light orange color. A little bit too sweet but a nice beer, especially for the summer time. Im a huge fan of fruit beers though some Im some what bias. Overall  would be a little better if it was slightly heavier but pretty solid.

On Draft @ Callys. Pours an off reddish color with a lemon/pine hop nose. Much milder bitterness than expected. Grassy dry flavor but very good and a beautiful example of hop balance. Best beer I have had @ Callys yet.

On Draft @ Callys. Like the last guy said its on a nitro tap. Very thin creamy head and a jet black color. No real aroma other than alcohol. Reminds me a lot of bailys irish cream, and its way to over powering and thick. Good lasting roast flavor. To heavy, not evened out enough with hops and malts to make this drinkable over a long period of time. Definitely can be improved with some work.

4 oz sample @ Callys. Dark reddish amber pour with a very sweet malty nose. Pretty thin mouth feel. Very malty, not all that hoppy. A pretty solid brew. They apparently won a medal for this beer. Very good lacing.

24 oz bottle. Pretty hoppy with a pine/fruity nose. Pours a good orange color with a medium white head. Very carbonated and over powered with hops and not much else detectable. After taste not favorable. Way to simplistic of a beer and very bland, way over-rated.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Harvest Wet Hop IPA - Northern Hemisphere

review_blob: 12 oz bottle. Pours a yellow cloudy grapefruit color, no real defining nose, hints of wheat, lemon and peach. Very acidic reminds me of a Flemish sour almost even though I am not familiar with this style.  Carbonated with a medium white head a pretty strong after taste.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a light amber color with a medium white head that diminishes quickly. Very strong berry nose and cherry, smells amazing. Taste is very fizzy and pretty flat but a decent overall flavor. A decent summer beer in my opinion overall.

750 ml bottle 10/11/07. Pours a bourbon color with no head and a nose over powered by honey with slight scent of pecan. No head at all considering style. Drank cold but probably be better if drank on the warmer end. Strong taste of church dessert wine. Alcohol not hidden very well, certainly present in every sip. My first mead but certainly not my last. Good overall beer

12 oz. bottle. Pours a light orange color with a thin white diminishing head an d a nose of heavy wheats and fruits maybe orange and/or bananas? Real good lacing. Deep spices, a little thin at the end. Very carbonated. Maybve a little too complex for me to even figure out all of the flavors and layers in this brew. A very good beer that if I ad more of and a better glass i could give a better rating. Nice beer!

12 oz. bottle 11/13/06. Pours a dark cloudy orange color with a sweet malty, fruity nose. Thin tan head that quickly diminishes. Spicy flavors, reminds me of a more fruit and flavor filled spice beer like that of anchor christmas. Hints of citrus, possibly lemon with a hint of alcohol to finish off the taste. Quite frankly a very weak unimpressive palate to end a real solid beer. Flavors are pretty weak when you let it sit in your mouth and after taste is not there. Other than the ending a pretty impressive brew in my opinion.

11/9/06 12 oz. can. What can I say, another straw, thin water taste. Another american light macro that I enjoy for the only purpose of going to parties and getting drunk with companyStill my favorite macro is PBR.

11/09/06 bottle 2006 vintage. Pours a small thin head and a dark orange amber color. Thin head stays for good amount of time. Very sweet caramel and pines. Good strong solid taste, kind of old cellar like taste with moderate bitterness and then after taste holds stronger bitter taste. Very dry at the end as well. A very good beer with one strong flavor that I just cant put my finger on. Very much worth the try and a very good barley wine at that.

10/05/06 12 oz. bottle. Pours a dark golden yellow wih a medium frothy white head. Very good lacing. Very dry tatsting good hop balance. A little bit of a sweet finish maybe honey? Very strong malt characteristics in smell and tatse. Palate leaves very quickly, so no real lasting impressions. A good drinking lager and a decent beer out of the state of Virginia. Cheers!

5/4/06 12 oz. bottle. Pours a brownish color great red hues, Large off-white head that disipates pretty quickly. Great flavors of smokey malts, pine and swwet fruit notes at the end of the sip. Great balance of malts and sweetness.

5/4/06 12 oz. bottle.  Pours a muddy light brown color with  fairly small tan head thats leaves quickly. No true distinct nose, slightly nutty aroma but not overpowering. Lots of carbonation and chewy taste. A slight bite in the aftertaste that I think is necessary to make the beer respectable and good. Full of off-caramel tasting malts. To dark in my opinion to be an american pale ale but the good hops make the flavors lean towards this style. Leaves a good taste in the back of your throat. Pretty decent texture.

12 oz bottle. 3/14/06.  Pours a golden straw color with a resonable short lasting white head. Nose of thin pine a citrus, slightly pungent. Nose doesnt come through in the flavors. Starts quite strong then kind of flat lines. Good lasting flavor and a favorable finish. Reminds me a more watered down hoegarden but to my palate much more pleasing. Very good brew from lost coaat.

12/28/05 bottle @ The Ginger Man. Poured a medium brown creamy head and a jet black color. Great malts good strong mocha flavor and nose. Very carbonated which was very surprising to me. Very crunchy and ntty from start to finish. Palate was great really held flavors roasts and malts for a good amount of time. This and Blue Point Oatmeal stout are the two bes I have had.
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2006

12/28/05 draft @ The Ginger Man. This is my first experience with this style, but i see that it reads the meaning is best when aged. This beer to me was disapointing at best. The beer itself wasnt bad, but their wasnt anything incrdible about it or anything that really stuck out. Poured an orange/copper color with a small white head. A red wine and hint of caramel in the smell. It was very sugary from the beginning ot the end almost too much for my likings. The palate was the only thing that was better than average about it. It held flavors real well and kept you wanting to sip a little more. I hope their is better in this style.
beer_name: Southampton Biere de Garde (French Country Christmas Ale)

review_blob: 12/28/05 draft @ The Ginger Man. Poured a very dark yellow/orange color, small white head a decent blueberry aroma. The beer had good wheat character that was balanced by the mild blueberry taste. Palate gets a little thin but it was expected for not being a real dark brew. Good lacing. Could be a little better with a heavier body but good all around.

12/28/05 on Tap @ St. Marks Ale House NYC. Pours a small white head with a very light amber body and scents of fruits. The citrus aroma and flavor is off set by some other natural sugars. Hops are present and balance the frutiness out very nicely. Hops dont overpower the beer though. I love this style. I only wish their were more cal. commons to try.

12 oz. bottle 12/24/05. A pretty good light beer. Definatly similar to that of the traditional lager. More watered down and nothing to great. Other than apperaling to light beer drinkers its not all that great. For sure one of the best light beers ive tried obviously behind Samuel Adams Light.

12 oz. bottle 12/24/05. Pours a dark red color with an orange tint and thin off-white head. No true overpowering smells. Hops are real good but definatly light in tatse. Tastes like a more fruitful and fullfilling Killians without the bitterness and watery character. Palate is a bit too thin for my likings but not terrible . Good thick lacing. A very solid irish ale from start to finish.

12 oz. bottle 12/23/05 @ golden rail. Beer poured a bright yellow color with no head and smelled absolutley aweful. Kind of like really bad budweiser as if bud isnt bad enough already. Little bit of citrus. Just an all around bad news beer that I know I will never see the $4 from that ever again.

12/23/05 16 oz. dfart @ golden rail. I was extrmely lucky to get this beer after Ill let it get away from me last holiday season. I had this at the Golden Rail in Newburgh NY which I would assume is one of the last kegs of it around. Pours a deep red color with a thin brown head and very spicy/hoppy nose. Pineish fruit flavors and scent. Rosemary to me seems to be one of the dominating scents and flavors. Lasting flavor from start to finish. Great lacing. Spices are balanced nicely with the hops. I love Anchor Brewing!

12/23/05 16oz. draft @ golden rail. A good copper color with an average white head. I tasted a lot of caramel flavors and a little bitter perhaps. I thought it was a barley wine because to me the alcohol was clearly defined. My first middle ages brew and hopefully more to come.

12/23/05 small bottle @ golden rail. Poured a very muddy red color with a very thin head. Nose bursts with grapes and kinda of a very sweet dessert wine. Flavors are also of grape and the 12% is hardley noticed. Fig or grainy feel throughout the brew. Nice beer that I was very happy to have tried.

12/23/05 16 oz. draft @ golden rail. Pours a small white head with a deep copper color and a red tint. Real good nose of thin fruits. Hops balance perfectly with the fruit flavors and are not overpowering. The thing I thought was the most unique was its palate which was probably the best I have ever had for an IPA. The beer isnt watery and really holds its flavors from start to finish. A great brew from Lake Placid.

750 ml bottle 12/19/05. Pours a jet black color with a huge brown head. Original taste is vey fizzy and carbonated like but then the beer once swollowed flat lines a bit a finsihes very nicely with a slightly watery but good chocolate roast flavor. Very nutty/hazelnut aroma. I would like to see some stronger qualities in the beers body as far as keeping a fuller flavor throughout. Good brew.

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: 12 oz bottle/2004 vintage. 12/19/05. Pours a deep copper color with a red tint and a thin brown head. I dont know what kind of hops are in this beer but they are very spicy. The initial sip of the beer seems to be very heavy and spicy but after a second and then swollowing the intensity and complexity of the beer settles and yuor left with a more thin feeling in your mouth. The high alcohol content is very noticable unlike some strong beers. An unbelieveable balance by the brewer of spice and still managing to keep a great flavor without over powering the entire beer. Possibly the best barley wine I have tried.
beer_name: Hair of the Dog Doggie Claws (2003-)

review_blob: large bottle 12/19/05. This is my first flemish sour and it was not at all what I expected. Extremely vinagar like in taste and smell. Very acidic. Reminded me of beer mixed with carbonated apple cider. Poured a cherry wood color with a decent head. I am going to have to try some others in this style but my first impressions are no better than average.

22 oz. bottle 12/19/05. Pours a small white non--lasting head. Orange smell with a hint of lemon zest. Deep golden yellow color and very hazy. The beer is just  filled with fruit and especially citrus flavors and although not present in the smell their is a slight hop flavor in the aftertaste. I love summer beers!

12 oz. bottle 12/19/05. Pours a very bubbly mid-yellow color with no head. Light citrus aroma and dry wood scent, maybe a little hint of white wine smell. Thin crisp and clean taste. High alcohol content not noticed. Either honey or a more natural sweetness. Very thin short lived mouth feel and doesnt return. Only my second traditional ale but really starting to like the style.
beer_name: Dogfish Head Midas Touch Golden Elixir

review_blob: Can. Had this beer in a huge can a few months back but I remember it very well cause it wasnt very good. Very light yellow in color and very wheaty smell. Slightly better than an American Macro but not much better. If you smelled the top of the can it smelled skunked. Im sure ill drink this sometime again.

12 oz. bottle 11/12/05. Pours a medium brown color with red hues. Medium off-white creamy head. Bad malts to the nose and taste. Extremley watery and kind of tasteless. Little bit smokey taste. Very un-impressed.
beer_name: Carolina Beer Co. Cottonwood Low Down  Brown Ale

review_blob: 12 oz bottle 11/4/05. Pours a good amber color off white head. Very hoppy and delicious. Nose of the forest (trees) and caramel. Decent beer but nothing special.
UPDATED: MAY 24, 2006
beer_name: Flying Dog Tire Bite Golden Ale

review_blob: 12 oz. corked bottle 11/3/05. Pours a light murky brown color with off-orange hues. Apparently this has been aging for nearly 8 years now and it is definatly apparrent in the smell. Kind of a musty smell and look. White wine/vinager nose with hints of caramel. Initial flavor is wineish but the 10% alcohol probably even more now cant be found anywhere in the beer. No carbination at all gives perception of watery. Some yeast particles floating about. I dont know, I think maybe aged a little to much. I would have liked to have this back in 2000 to see if their was a difference. Decent beer but nothing great. I had the qualities of a barley wine in my opinion.

bottle 11/3/05. Pours a very dark black color with a small white head. Aromas smell like light red wine but are not over-bearing on taste and texture. Roasted malts in the flavor as well as the nose with slight chocolate hints. Very smooth but a little dry and watery in the finish. The bottle that I had seemed really fresh. Good beer from Sierra one of my favorite brewing companies.

gowler from brewery 10/27/05. Pours a chocolate brown color with a creamy brown medium head. Head doesnt last. Smells of chocolate malts and a secent of cherry at the end. Very creamy finish roast malt flavor. Slightly bitter throughout. Full of flavor and very fulfilling from beginning to end. Although it is low in alcohol I felt like I could taste a strong alcohol flavor. Great beer. Best Oatmeal Stout/Sweet Stout ive had yet.

Growler from brewery 10/24/05. Pours an orange amber color with medium white head. Light citrus smell all first then then it kind of reminded me of the ocean which is kind of strange. Good firstg flavor but becomes watery. Slight tang in the aftertaste. Good lacing but head disapates very quickly.

growler from brewery 10/22/05. Pours a light brown color almost like a light coca-cola with a slight yellow tint. Fizzy body with no real head to be spoken of. Full bodied and no lacing. Light roast smell and maybe a fruity hint. When you first drink it it is originally sweet with some hop characters but then it ends slightly dry which allows in to have more character in my opinion. Good beer from Blue Point.

Tap at half time in May 2005. Poured a small dark tan head and a very muddy brown/black color. Strong flavors of smoke and coffee. It was from the bottom of the keg so I may have not gotten the greatest sample to try. Not a favorable finish.
UPDATED: OCT 27, 2008

Bottle in May 2005. Pours a straw yellow color. Medium white head. Pretty smooth. Nothing much going on in this beer that is complex. Very fruit filled berry nose. It is like drinking a regular pale lager with some b lueberry flavoring. Could be worse.
22 oz. Bottle in May 2005. Pours a jet black color with a thick and creamy body. No real head to speak of. Nose of burnt coal but good. Extremley smooth beer. Good lacing. Very good stout.
beer_name: Bear Republic Big Bear Black Stout

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: Bottle in May 2005. Poured a large brown head and a dark brown color with a tint of red throughout. Head stays through the duration of the beer. Starts slightly bitter finishes pretty clean but still has a small bite. Burnt taste and smell. Alcohol is not hidden very well although that doesnt bother me at all. My first Hair of the Dog beer and first traditional ale. Definatly not my last.

Im proud to say im still a college boy and beast here in Virginia is the beer of choice. Beast is definatly not a good beer but often ultimatly thats what it comes down to. Another yellow straw macro from Miller that is by no means good but I deal with it. College life could onyl be better if their were kegs of Sam Adams!! God Bless Beast.
